Body: In trying to get this code sample working on Windows 10 (prior to running on Windows IoT) with Visual Studio 2017
column9:
I've run up against this message:

Add the exe to the AppX package

Also
column10:
when reading this article it states:

When a relative path is specified; such as SampleConsoleApp.exe
column13:
the ProcessLauncher API looks for the exe file starting at the package root of the AppX deployed.

I thought the exe in question could then be part of the project being run and would be allowed permission to execute. However
column14:
I get this error:

Exception Thrown: Access is denied. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80070005 (E_ACCESSDENIED))

How do I "add the exe to the AppX package"?

"

Body: I know you didnâ€™t say this directly, but are you implying that the instructions in the article I referenced are not valid for the Windows 10 desktop but only only for Windows IoT?

The ProcessLauncher API belongs to Windows IoT Extension SDK. So, you are right. [These Extension SDKs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/uwp/extension-sdks/) introduce some other APIs does not belong to Universal Windows Platform by default in order to target specific devices.

There is no emulator for Windows IoT Core. You can try to set up a Virtual Machine. You can check these related threads:[1](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/8dc8022c-451f-4b45-9c6d-af3c7d43169e/how-to-deploy-windows-10-iot-rasp-pi-image-as-a-virtual-machine?forum=WindowsIoT) and [2](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/windowsapps/en-US/c0cf17d3-d88c-43dc-a34b-8a197cd6c1ab/windows-iot-core-in-an-emulator?forum=WindowsIoT).

I can reproduce your issue. If you want to launch another EXE from UWP on the desktop you can reference [this thread](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/windowsapps/en-US/a78aa7b8-9d80-4282-8ecb-1496b2535c81/uwpaccess-denied-another-exe-module-by-desktop-bridge?forum=wpdevelop).
Thank you for your help. I am wondering why it is not possible to test (potentially a lot of) software on a Windows machine without a device (outside of requirement specific hardware.)
